intro: Cyphia eritreana, commonly known as the Eritrean Cyphia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyphia eritreana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
